1.brief: to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)
'I pray', 'now', or 'then'; added mostly to verbs (in the Imperative or Future), or to interjections, occasionally to an adverb or conjunction
Ijob, the patriarch famous for his patience
a word; collectively, a discourse; figuratively, a topic
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
a word; by implication, a matter (as spoken of) or thing; adverbially, a cause
to broaden out the ear (with the hand), i.e. (by implication) to listen

2.brief: 'I pray', 'now', or 'then'; added mostly to verbs (in the Imperative or Future), or to interjections, occasionally to an adverb or conjunction
to open wide (literally or figuratively); specifically, to loosen, begin, plough, carve
the mouth (as the means of blowing), whether literal or figurative (particularly speech); specifically edge, portion or side; adverbially (with preposition) according to
perhaps properly, to arrange; but used figuratively (of words), to speak; rarely (in a destructive sense) to subdue
the tongue (of man or animals), used literally (as the instrument of licking, eating, or speech), and figuratively (speech, an ingot, a fork of flame, a cove of water)
properly, the palate or inside of the mouth; hence, the mouth itself (as the organ of speech, taste and kissing)

3.brief: the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything
the lip (as a natural boundary); by implication, language; by analogy, a margin (of a vessel, water, cloth, etc.)

4.brief: wind; by resemblance breath, i.e. a sensible (or even violent) exhalation; figuratively, life, anger, unsubstantiality; by extension, a region of the sky; by resemblance spirit, but only of a rational being (including its expression and functions)
strength; as adjective, mighty; especially the Almighty (but used also of any deity)
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
a puff, i.e. wind, angry or vital breath, divine inspiration, intellect. or (concretely) an animal
to live, whether literally or figuratively; causatively, to revive

5.brief: used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
to be able, literally (can, could) or morally (may, might)
to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again
to set in a row, i.e. arrange, put in order (in a very wide variety of applications)
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
to place (any thing so as to stay); reflexively, to station, offer, continue

6.brief: the mouth (as the means of blowing), whether literal or figurative (particularly speech); specifically edge, portion or side; adverbially (with preposition) according to
strength; as adjective, mighty; especially the Almighty (but used also of any deity)
properly, a bubbling up, i.e. of water, a wave; of earth, mire or clay (cement); also a heap; hence, a chomer or dry measure
to pinch, i.e. (partially) to bite the lips, blink the eyes (as a gesture of malice), or (fully) to squeeze off (a piece of clay in order to mould a vessel from it)
properly, assemblage; used only adverbially also, even, yea, though; often repeated as correl. both...and

7.brief: fright; concrete, an idol (as a bugbear)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
a load; by implication, a stroke (others dignity)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to be heavy, i.e. in a bad sense (burdensome, severe, dull) or in a good sense (numerous, rich, honorable; causatively, to make weighty (in the same two senses)

8.brief: a particle of affirmation, surely; hence (by limitation) only
broadness. i.e. (concrete) the ear (from its form in man)
a word; collectively, a discourse; figuratively, a topic
to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)

9.brief: properly, failure, i.e. nothing or destruction; usually (with preposition) without, not yet, because not, as long as, etc.
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles

10.brief: above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
properly, to come forth to, i.e. appear or exist; transitively, to attain, i.e. find or acquire; figuratively, to occur, meet or be present

properly, to plait or interpenetrate, i.e. (literally) to weave or (generally) to fabricate; figuratively, to plot or contrive (usually in a malicious sense); hence (from the mental effort) to think, regard, value, compute

11.brief: to put (used in a great variety of applications, literal, figurative, inferentially, and elliptically)
a foot (as used in walking); by implication, a step; by euphemistically the pudenda
properly, to hedge about (as with thorns), i.e. guard; generally, to protect, attend to, etc.
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
a well-trodden road (literally or figuratively); also a caravan

12.brief: not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to be (causatively, make) right (in a moral or forensic sense)
properly, to eye or (generally) to heed, i.e. pay attention; by implication, to respond; by extension to begin to speak; specifically to sing, shout, testify, announce
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
a man in general (singly or collectively)

13.brief: near, with or among; often in general, to
properly, to toss, i.e. grapple; mostly figuratively, to wrangle, i.e. hold a controversy; (by implication) to defend
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
a word; by implication, a matter (as spoken of) or thing; adverbially, a cause
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
properly, to eye or (generally) to heed, i.e. pay attention; by implication, to respond; by extension to begin to speak; specifically to sing, shout, testify, announce

14.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
properly, united, i.e. one; or (as an ordinal) first
perhaps properly, to arrange; but used figuratively (of words), to speak; rarely (in a destructive sense) to subdue
strength; as adjective, mighty; especially the Almighty (but used also of any deity)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to spy out, i.e. (generally) survey, (for evil) lurk for, (for good) care for

15.brief: properly, a twist (away of the light), i.e. night; figuratively, adversity
to fall, in a great variety of applications (intransitive or causative, literal or figurative)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a bed (figuratively, a bier); abstractly, sleep; by euphemism, carnal intercourse

16.brief: at that time or place; also as a conjunction, therefore
to denude (especially in a disgraceful sense); by implication, to exile (captives being usually stripped); figuratively, to reveal
broadness. i.e. (concrete) the ear (from its form in man)
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
to close up; especially to seal

17.brief: ruddy i.e. a human being (an individual or the species, mankind, etc.)
an action (good or bad); generally, a transaction; abstractly, activity; by implication, a product (specifically, a poem) or (generally) property
properly, a valiant man or warrior; generally, a person simply
properly, to plump, i.e. fill up hollows; by implication, to cover (for clothing or secrecy)

18.brief: to restrain or (reflex.) refrain; by implication, to refuse, spare, preserve; to observe
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)
properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses
a pit (especially as a trap); figuratively, destruction
alive; hence, raw (flesh); fresh (plant, water, year), strong; also (as noun, especially in the feminine singular and masculine plural) life (or living thing), whether literally or figuratively
to cross over; used very widely of any transition (literal or figurative; transitive, intransitive, intensive, causative); specifically, to cover (in copulation)
a missile of attack, i.e. spear; also (figuratively) a shoot of growth; i.e. branch

19.brief: to be right (i.e. correct); reciprocal, to argue; causatively, to decide, justify or convict
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a bed (figuratively, a bier); abstractly, sleep; by euphemism, carnal intercourse
a bone (as strong); by extension, the body; figuratively, the substance, i.e. (as pron.) selfsame
permanence; hence (concrete) permanent; specifically a chieftain

20.brief: to be rancid, i.e. (transitively) to loathe
alive; hence, raw (flesh); fresh (plant, water, year), strong; also (as noun, especially in the feminine singular and masculine plural) life (or living thing), whether literally or figuratively
food (for man or beast), especially bread, or grain (for making it)
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)
an eatable (includ. provender, flesh and fruit)
a longing; by implication, a delight (subjectively, satisfaction, objectively, a charm)

21.brief: to end, whether intransitive (to cease, be finished, perish) or transitived (to complete, prepare, consume)
flesh (from its freshness); by extension, body, person; also (by euphemistically) the pudenda of aman
sight, whether abstractly (vision) or concretely (a spectacle)
bareness; concretely, a bare hill or plain
a bone (as strong); by extension, the body; figuratively, the substance, i.e. (as pron.) selfsame
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)

a pit (especially as a trap); figuratively, destruction

there is or are (or any other form of the verb to be, as may suit the connection)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a messenger; specifically, of God, i.e. an angel (also a prophet, priest or teacher)
properly, to make mouths at, i.e. to scoff; hence (from the effort to pronounce a foreign language) to interpret, or (generally) intercede
properly, united, i.e. one; or (as an ordinal) first

ruddy i.e. a human being (an individual or the species, mankind, etc.)

24.brief: properly, to bend or stoop in kindness to an inferior; to favor, bestow; causatively to implore (i.e. move to favor by petition)

to descend (literally, to go downwards; or conventionally to a lower region, as the shore, a boundary, the enemy, etc.; or figuratively, to fall); causatively, to bring down (in all the above applications)

properly, to come forth to, i.e. appear or exist; transitively, to attain, i.e. find or acquire; figuratively, to occur, meet or be present
properly, a cover, i.e. (literally) a village (as covered in); (specifically) bitumen (as used for coating), and the henna plant (as used for dyeing); figuratively, a redemption-price

to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again
